data.name: update
data.body:
I'm not sure if I can edit ideas on here so I'm adding additional info here:

I made a mistake in the original description - the importer is part of the access-server NOT the web-interface

data.name: Back to Jon for fixes
data.body: QA was mostly accomplished, but hit a QA -ending bug that wiped out earlier QA data. Also other smaller bugs to fix.

data.name: Tentative UI/UX Feel for this feature
data.body: Can you do a quick mock up of how you envision this feature on Windows PC?

data.name: UI/UX Decision/Sketch on how to handle this story
data.body: Can we just add a confirmation that we are alerting everyone instead of a bunch of extra work?  This is changing an established workflow, we need to be sure we are handling it properly.

data.name: This is a larger scope of envisioning work, just want to get you thinking about it.
data.body: Round 1 should be what a modular design would look like, How a user would view plugins, how a user would add a plugin to the board, and how a user would move and resize a plugin.

data.name: Back to Tyler for QA (see description)
data.body:
Since we are moving away from testfairy, I will instead be putting the android APKs on our own server for internal testing.

https://dev1-or.active911.com/android/1.5.7.1/

I am also building multiple APKs per build version, each pointed at a different API.

The ones you care about are the prodAPI and qaAPI ones.

You CAN install both APKs on the same device.  The Launch Icon for each is different and makes clear which API the app is pointed to.  (The launch icon with no markings is pointed at Production)

You still CANNOT install the one pointed at prod alongside the Google Play Store version since the testing one is not signed.

data.name: Can you review the acceptance tests i put in there?
data.body: This was missing acceptance tests, can you make sure the 3 I put make sense and add more if you have any?

On my device, I unregistered my production version, uninstalled it, reinstalled from the link, and it loads with my previous device code in it no matter what I do.

data.name: Answer this question.
data.body:
A free addition we coded awhile ago for displaying a map in a web widget is now broken.  It is broken because google now requires an api key for accessing static maps.  That API key is what we pay google big money for, adding a hit every time someone wants a widget will be a huge expense.

Is it acceptable, since they are basically coding the web widget anyway, to make them input a google maps api key that they can generate for free?  It lets them have like 1000 requests/day for free, it is just an extra step they need to do for displaying the widget, but it negates a huge cost we would incur to make it more user friendly.

data.name: Release it?  Is a week enough time to find buts in external beta?
back for fixes
data.body:
Two bugs were found: AC-591 and AC-592.

AC-591 I am pretty sure is the alert server, just confirm that it is not the access server and I can move it.

AC-592 I'd like fixed in QA so we can be confident the access server doesn't have any bugs that we falsely attribute to QA.

data.name: Looks like this is good to go
QA Android 1.5.7.6
data.body:
This is a small release. Aside from FEAT-477 this contains fixes  for 3 of the top 5 crashes that were showing up in the Play Store.  Please test for these as well if possible, they are corner cases so it may be difficult to reproduce the exact circumstances:

1) On rare occasion, the app will crash on the map because it tries to display a device that it does not have in it's database.  This is most likely to occur if the app is just opened and the map is immediately opened, when it hasn't had a chance to parse its get_all_volatile data yet.

2) The alert report was crashing on rare occasion, it looks like it could be when the app is backgrounded while on the report page and then reopened.

3) The background location update would sometimes crash if the location update service is started before the app has a chance to fully initialize, which could be when the app is silently killed in the background due to resource constraints and then started up again by the OS when resources are again available for it.

 

Android build available here: https://dev1-or.active911.com/android/1.5.7.6/

data.name: Need a nightly QA for this feature.
Needs QA
data.body:
This is on the qa network. You should be able to create and use a web widget as normal again. here is some sample code that you should be able to use. You may want to check with Bryan to see if he actually wants you to QA this, but it should be as simple as saving the following code in a `.html` file and loading it with a web browser.

 

```

<!DOCTYPE html>
  <body>
    <div id="a91_syndication"></div>
    <script src="https://qa-access.active911.com/js.php?r3vd3" type="text/javascript" />
    <script type="text/javascript"> try{a91.init({'abbreviate_addresses': true, 'api_key': 'AIzaSyDK8k1v18XjF1QuAw6Bwwwvgl3aiSjVuac'}); } catch(e) {} </script>
  </body>
</html>

```

 

You should also be able to use any device pointed at the qa network or qa-webview.active911.com and see that new icon colors don't break the app. New icon colors should not show up on the app, but the app should gracefully handle colors that it does not know about. For instance, I have added the following marker to the Id 3 test agency.

 

```

+----------+-----------+------+-------------+---------------+------------+---------+-------------+---------------+
| id | agency_id | name | description | location_type | icon_color | icon_id | lat | lon |
+----------+-----------+------+-------------+---------------+------------+---------+-------------+---------------+
| 13787181 | 3 | NAME | DESC | building | black | 71 | 44.54057000 | -123.35440000 |
+----------+-----------+------+-------------+---------------+------------+---------+-------------+---------------+

```

 

When you look at those coordinates, you should not see a black marker, but you should see a marker and the app should not crash.

data.name: Back to you for fixes
data.body:
AC-719 did not work against QA or PROD using 1.5.8.3

I encountered AC-666 while just using the app from an overnight period of inactivity.  Happened a couple of times then resolved itself as soon as I tapped a response action.

AC-563 Appears mostly refined, but some general confusion on how it should operate led me to add new acceptance tests, and one failed.

AC-266 - Colors except fluorescent green can be used to edit markers, but the correct color is not being displayed on the map.

AC-424 - There were missing requirements/acceptance tests in this feature. The have been updated.

AC-727 and AC-728 Are probably related to other bugs dicsovered in the QA process.  Weird things occur when the app is not completely nuked unregistering/switching device codes.

AC-732 must get fixed

data.name: Windows Phone fails to unregister.  Needs to be fixed to non block QA.
data.body:
The first step of QA is to register and unregister a device, that failed, resulting in 

AC-730.

Also found:

AC-731

AC-675 - Support has an alerting routine they follow for every round of QA.  Following that should cause this problem to be reproducible.  I attempted to go through it, but I could not enter my device code in this build version.

data.name: Full QA on Windows Phone - Round 3
data.body:
Builds are available at: https://dev1-or.active911.com/windows/2017.9.26.0/

These builds can be installed by you. You must have a windows 10 phone as earlier windows phones won't allow you to install manually. Just copy the file to the phone and then find it in File Explorer and click on it. Select yes to install. Now the phone will not show you the progress of the installation for some reason, but just be patient and it will show up in the apps list when it is ready. Should be less than a minute.

It is also available on qa-interface.active911.com if you want to test things without affecting production.

Full QA for Android 1.5.8.8
data.body:
I have created a new Production Android Hotfix build.

This is build 1.5.8.8

This does NOT include any features from the 1.5.9.x nightly line of builds.

There is only one change from 1.5.8.7, but it is a change in a piece of code used by all API requests, so a full QA is required to ensure none of the API calls are broken by the change.

The specific feature this fixes is the send_alert issue.  It should now be possible to send any UTF-8 character in the notes field.

https://dev1-or.active911.com/android/1.5.8.8

data.name: AC-758 was not testable, and AC-442 was missing.  Fix and re-qa.
full QA Windows Builds
data.body:
It looks like there were two problems. One is that the version of the app on the phone was not actually the latest version that needed QAd. For this I have updated the documentation at https://github.com/active911/beethoven/wiki/SUPPORT-DOC:-Installing-Windows-Builds . The other problem is that it seemed like the windows tablet that QA is using to test the tablet version of the app is acting peculiar and even running chrome incorrectly. For this, I have provided QA with the development windows tablet to perform QA on.

So, the previous build should have passed, but I made one optimization to the personnel view in this release. So I built a new release anyways. It can be found at: https://dev1-or.active911.com/windows/2017.11.6.200/

data.name: Phone and Tablet still fail to unregister, fix and re-QA
design how machine classified alerts should appear.  If you have one already, just upload it.
Release to Production
data.body: This will be released to production if External Beta reports no issues.

data.name: full QA Windows Builds
data.body:
I've done something kind of different to fix this. I've verified that it has fixed the problem, but I had also verified that the previous fix worked so we will see.

The fix is a departure from how we have done things for all the previous builds so I wonder if this was broken in previous builds.

Nightlies are available here. https://dev1-or.active911.com/windows/2017.11.7.202/

data.body: Available here: https://dev1-or.active911.com/windows/2017.11.9.200/

data.name: Full QA for Android 1.6.0.2
data.body:
I have fixed the issues where "Off duty available" was not showing up, and the chat feature is now available in production.

 

Here is the new build:

1

data.name: Full QA Windows Builds
data.body:
CURRENT BUILD: https://dev1-or.active911.com/windows/2017.11.12.200/

I have fixed the assignment capability check that failed this in the last release. It turns out that that issue is actually in the live version of the app.

I have also tried to implement all features that were not implemented completely across all apps. 

Assignment override has now been implemented in the PC app.

Preview ringtones and ringtone selection have been added to all apps.

Notifications have been added to the PC. So, when the PC is assigned to an assignment, they will be notified.

data.name: Full QA For Android 1.6.0.3
data.body:
Map Data issue is a known issue, scheduled for fix in the next release after this one:

https://active911.aha.io/features/A911FEAT-630

 

Chat issue A has been resolved, it was a bug with editing device capabilities.  Turn chat on the agency off, and then back on again.  The agency should then appear in the chat list on next app restart.

 

Fast Beep LONG has been added to the Android app.

 

New Full QA build available:

https://dev1-or.active911.com/android/1.6.0.3/

 

Assigning back to Grant

Fixed duplicate chat message issue.

https://dev1-or.active911.com/android/1.6.0.4/

data.body: what would the device tab look like?

data.name: Full QA for Android 1.6.0.5
data.body:
Fixed issues with app crashing.

Fixed issue where, after clearing the device code out, the app would not prompt for device code on startup.

For large agencies, the "Connecting..." to "Connected" will still take 30-40 seconds due to the large amount of devices that needs to be stored.

The new build is available here:

https://dev1-or.active911.com/android/1.6.0.5/

data.name: QA is failing before even unregistering.  Need a fix for Ac-983 before we can proceed
Full QA of Alert Server
data.body:
The updated code has been deployed to alert2-or.active911.com, which works on the production system and production data.

You can send alerts to the alert email using "alert2-or.active911.com" instead of "alert.active911.com"

Some rough notes on what can be tested are in the comments of the story.

The main goal is to make sure this doesn't break any existing functionality for users.

data.name: fix AC-988 and we can roll to external beta and get it re-qa'ed
Full QA for Android 1.6.0.7
data.body:
Noticed some new crashes in the 1.6.0.7 beta.

A couple are corner cases that are not easily reproduced.

The main one is that deletion of map markers was failing.  Make sure to add that to the testing regimen.

Also make sure to check that pagegroup settings, turning them on and off, works, there was a small change to that code.

The new build is available here:

https://dev1-or.active911.com/android/1.6.0.7/

data.name: design - website header search bar
data.body: I really enjoy the Aha! search button and I think it reflects where we'd like to head, but you might have other ideas.  I attached a couple views in particular

data.name: design - hard deadline - support search bar results page
data.body: Once a user has typed a search term, we need a view designed of what the results would show.  conceptually, I think a simple search page that shows what a user would care about with an option to re-search would be nice.  took a few pictures for how I might expect it to feel.

data.name: iOS is good to go whenver you think it's ready
Partial QA for iOS 1.5.19 (5479)
data.body:
We should do one more round of QA before rolling this release. It doesn't need to be a full QA because the changes since the previously Full QAed build only affect alerting/notifications.

 

Build to test:

Use the build 1.5.19 (5479) available via TestFlight. If you run into any blocking issues first try deleting your existing app before installing the TestFlight build (instead of installing it 'on top' of your existing app). 

 

What to test:

Use the 'alerting/notifications' section of your list for QA (notifications while the app is background & closed, response options in banner, etc.), repeating the tests w/ the new continuous re-paging option both on & off. If this isn't clear feel free to either do a full QA instead or message me for more information. Thanks!

data.name: Partial QA for iOS 1.5.19 (5490)
data.body:
Same process as the previous todo:

https://active911.aha.io/tasks/6499108680163826150

 

We need to verify that the bug that was encountered in that build is no longer present in this build (notifications no longer working after switching to 'continuous re-paging' under certain scenarios).

data.name: Windows Nightly Build QA
data.body:
Nightly Version 2018.1.3.0

Version 2018.1.3.0: https://dev1-or.active911.com/windows/2018.1.3.0/

There was a bug that caused the unread count to stop updating for an agency if the chat window had been opened at any point for that agency, which I have fixed. There was also a problem with the nightly build script that we are working around right now so the PC build should work.

data.name: Windows Phone Nightly
data.body:
https://docker2-tx.active911.com:8084/browse/AC-770

Nightly Version 2018.1.3.0

This is being sent back to QA with some additional instructions. There was no easy way to add an indicator to the menu without expanding the menu, so the menu should be expanded via the ellipses on the right side of the menu bar in order to view the unread chat count. I verified with Bryan that this meets the acceptance tests for this iteration of the chat feature.

I haven't been able to replicate the problem with the app not installing until the phone is restarted. If you encounter the issue again I can take a look at it before the app has been restarted.
